# Discord Channel Analysis: 💻│developers

## 1. Summary:
The discussion in the developers channel focused on several technical topics. Ashxn shared updates about new primitives with textures and a color picker prop created by Saori, requiring an npm install for the new color picker library. There was discussion about setting up a branch of the "voxel terrain island" project, with Ashxn noting that it would need a multiplayer networking system. Gert-Jan Akerboom demonstrated a UI-based approach for changing the cursor when objects are clickable by using a tiny screenspace UI element in the center of the screen. Ashxn shared a GitHub PR (#120) related to this functionality. The developers also discussed the potential of AI integration with the platform, suggesting features like text-to-app generation within worlds using an API key. Additionally, Ashxn mentioned that "peezy" has been working on local apps to facilitate larger builds and version control.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: How time consuming would it be to set up a branch of the "voxel terrain island"? (asked by .hyp shaman) A: Things have changed a lot but most is still relevant; it wasn't set up with multiplayer networking though, so it would need a system for that. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Will it be possible to animate this [cursor change functionality]? (asked by Gert-Jan Akerboom) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions:
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: .hyp shaman | Context: Setting up a branch of the voxel terrain island project | Resolution: Explained that while most content is still relevant, it would need a multiplayer networking system
Helper: Gert-Jan Akerboom | Helpee: Ashxn | Context: Changing cursor when objects are clickable | Resolution: Shared a solution using tiny screenspace UI in the center of the screen

# Discord Chat Analysis: 🧊│3d-design

## 1. Summary:
The discussion focused on how to make windows in 3D models allow light to pass through without casting shadows in Hyperfy environments. 𝕽𝖔𝖚𝖘𝖙𝖆𝖓 initially tried toggling "cast shadows" and "allow light" properties in Blender without success. Two main solutions emerged: (1) flipping normals, as suggested by vox, which allows light to pass through meshes but may affect collision properties; and (2) disabling both castShadows and receiveShadows properties using the Hyperfy Blender plugin, as demonstrated by Ashxn. The discussion also touched on positioning challenges when separating window elements from buildings, with 𝕽𝖔𝖚𝖘𝖙𝖆𝖓 noting the need for more precise positioning controls (thousandths rather than tenths). Colliders were identified as potentially blocking light, with vox suggesting removing unnecessary colliders above areas players don't normally reach. Ashxn shared examples of transparent roofs and windows implemented using the Hyperfy Blender plugin, providing a link to the GitHub repository containing the addon.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: Does anyone know how to make windows not cast a shadow and allow light through in world? (asked by 𝕽𝖔𝖚𝖘𝖙𝖆𝖓) A: Disable castShadows and receiveShadows using the Hyperfy Blender plugin (answered by Ashxn)
Q: How do I get that new hyperfy plugin? (asked by 𝕽𝖔𝖚𝖘𝖙𝖆𝖓) A: It's in the github repo: https://github.com/hyperfy-xyz/hyperfy/blob/dev/docs/extras/blender-addon.py (answered by Ashxn)

## 3. Help Interactions:
Helper: vox | Helpee: 𝕽𝖔𝖚𝖘𝖙𝖆𝖓 | Context: Making windows allow light through without casting shadows | Resolution: Suggested flipping normals and provided examples in Hyperfy worlds
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: 𝕽𝖔𝖚𝖘𝖙𝖆𝖓 | Context: Making windows allow light through without casting shadows | Resolution: Provided alternative solution using castShadows and receiveShadows properties in the Hyperfy Blender plugin with screenshots and GitHub link
